alert.note: Alert for Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 27 at 3:03AM CDT until March 27 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT FOR CENTRAL MACON COUNTY... At 302 AM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Franklin, or near Tuskegee, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Tuskegee, Franklin, Tuskegee National Forest, Uphapee Creek and Moton Field Municipal Airport. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
